hero_title: Quiz: Do you have the mentality of an Olympian?
hero_subtitle: Find out if you have the mindset needed to win gold or are you just an Olympic day dreamer?
question_1_question: Are you slapdash or spot on?
question_1_feedback: If you're thorough and pay close attention to detail you're likely to be successful across many areas of life, including sport. If you're not, it's time to knuckle down.
question_2_low: I'm tempted by the easy option
question_2_feedback: Setting high personal standards is helpful for a top athlete, but it's also important not to be too tough on yourself and keep your expectations realistic.
question_3_question: Fly or flop when the going gets hot?
question_3_feedback: You're on the start line of the 100m final and an audience of millions is watching your every move - can you cope? The best excel when the pressure is on.
question_4_question: Are you a rock star or a wallflower?
question_4_low: I'm a bit of a wallflower
question_4_feedback: Although perhaps not one of the nicest of qualities, those who have big egos can be very successful athletes. But not all elite athletes possess it and, remember, no-one likes a show off!
question_5_question: Take on the competition or check out of the rat race?
question_5_low: I only enter the rat race if I have to
question_5_feedback: You're not going to be an Olympic champion unless you want to compete with and beat people. Having a competitive streak will help bring out your best performance.
question_6_question: Do you start the party or wait for the invite?
question_6_highest: I always get it started! Why wait?
question_6_low: I usually wait for the invite
question_6_lowest: I never get the party started
question_6_feedback: Good things don't always come to those who wait. Seize the day and make it yours if you want to succeed.
question_7_question: Do you do things for the love of the game or material gain?
question_7_lowest: Material gain is my only motivation
question_7_low: Material gain is my main motivation
question_7_high: I'd say like, rather than love
question_7_highest: For the love of the game
question_7_feedback: How motivated are you? Often found on job adverts, it's there for a reason - having an internal drive is one of the key factors in being successful.
question_8_high: I'm happy to push my boundaries
question_8_low: I'm happy in my comfort zone
question_8_lowest: Do I have to do it?
question_8_feedback: Your biggest opponent is in the mirror. If you're fixated on improving your own personal performance and standards, it's more likely you'll go far.
question_9_feedback: Self-confidence is key to sporting success - just ask Usain Bolt... But it can swing dramatically depending on the situation so even Usain will have dips in his self-belief.
question_10_feedback: So you're still with us? Have you made it through without getting distracted? The brain can only focus on a limited amount of things at once so focusing on what matters is crucial.
question_11_question: Go it alone or look for help?
question_11_highest: I go it alone. I can cope by myself
question_11_high: I go it alone, most of the time
question_11_low: I look for help some of the time
question_11_lowest: I always look for help when I need it
question_11_feedback: No one is an island. Need some help? Ask your colleagues, family, friends, teammates, coach - they can all help boost your performance.
question_12_question: Target driven or hope for the best?
question_12_feedback: As you achieve your goals, you'll gain more belief in your ability and before you know it, you'll be achieving beyond your wildest dreams.
results_category_1_text: You have the mindset needed to challenge at the top level of competitive sport. It's only four years until the next Olympics - get training!
results_category_2_text: You have most of the mental strengths needed to be a good athlete, but you may struggle to challenge Usain Bolt and co to get on the medals podium.
results_category_3_text: It seems that you don't have the mentality of an Olympian, but you would be a great asset to any local sports team. Step it up if you want to get to the next level.
results_category_4_text: You don't have the mentality to compete in Olympic sport, but you could still enjoy sport at a recreational level. Time for a run?
results_category_5_text: It may come as no surprise that you don't seem to have the mental habits of an Olympian but you can still enjoy sport and exercise as a way of keeping active.
activity_1_text: Find more information on getting involved in sport and fitness at BBC Sport's participation campaign,
activity_2_text: Find more information on getting started with exercise and fitness at
tap_on_section: Tap on section to see your score out of five
share_result_1: I've got the mentality of an Olympian.
share_result_2: I've got the mentality of a Solid Athlete.
share_result_3: I've got the mentality of a Fitness Fan.
share_result_4: I've got the mentality of a Weekend Stroller.
share_result_5: I've got the mentality of a Day dreamer.
share_outro_text: Find out if you have what's needed to compete at #Rio2016.
credits_sub_title: Produced by Ashleigh Jackson, Scott Jarvis, Nathan Mercer and John Walton.
credits_external_sites_message: The BBC is not responsible for the content of external Internet sites
legacy_ie_message: You should upgrade to a modern browser.
method_text: This quiz was developed in collaboration with Dr David Fletcher, a sports psychologist from Loughborough University. The questions were designed to highlight key mental characteristics that are important for achieving at the highest levels of competitive sport.
hover_over_section: Hover over section to see your score out of five
